1.description: The last King of Narnia, young and tall with a fair beard. He loves his country deeply and is troubled by reports of Aslan behaving strangely.

2.description: Becomes increasingly disturbed by reports of Aslan's cruel behavior. Goes with Jewel to investigate the destruction of the sacred grove and the talking trees.

4.description: Captured and bound to a tree after confronting the Calormenes. Calls upon Aslan and the children from our world for help in Narnia's darkest hour.

5.description: Freed by Eustace and Jill, who have come to help. Plans to rescue Jewel and expose the false Aslan with the help of his young friends.

16.description: Dies in the final battle but enters the real Narnia through the stable door. Reunited with all the heroes of Narnia's history in Aslan's Country.
16.role: Honored king in the true Narnia

1.description: A clever and manipulative ape who lives by Caldron Pool. Claims to be wiser than other talking beasts and becomes increasingly greedy for power.

2.description: Forces Puzzle to wear the lion skin and pretend to be Aslan. Begins issuing orders in 'Aslan's' name, including selling talking horses to Calormen.

11.description: Becomes increasingly desperate and afraid as his deception unravels. Tries to maintain control but realizes he's lost power to the Calormenes.

1.description: A simple, honest donkey who is easily manipulated by Shift. He finds the lion skin floating in Caldron Pool and is reluctant to impersonate Aslan.

2.description: Forced to wear the lion skin and appear as Aslan to the other Narnians. He's deeply uncomfortable with the deception but too weak to resist Shift's manipulation.

13.description: Finally freed from the lion skin and able to speak the truth. Admits to the deception and begs forgiveness from the other Narnians.

16.description: Despite being used in the deception, his essential goodness and repentance allow him to enter the true Narnia.

5.description: One of the Friends of Narnia, called from our world to help in Narnia's last crisis. Appears with Jill to rescue King Tirian from his bonds.

16.description: Dies in the railway accident and enters the true Narnia. Reunited with all the heroes of Narnia, including Asian himself.

5.description: One of the Friends of Narnia, called from our world with Eustace to help King Tirian. Skilled with a bow and brave in battle.

16.description: Dies in the railway accident and enters the true Narnia. Reunited with all her friends from previous adventures.

1.description: King Tirian's dearest friend, a noble unicorn with a pearl-white coat and silver horn. Wise, brave, and completely loyal to the king.

2.description: Accompanies Tirian to investigate the destruction of the sacred grove. Shares the king's distress about Aslan's alleged cruel behavior.

16.description: Dies fighting bravely in the last battle and enters the true Narnia, where his beauty and nobility are even greater.

2.description: A Calormene captain who has made a deal with Shift to buy Narnian talking horses. Cunning and ambitious, he seeks to exploit the situation.

8.description: Reveals he doesn't truly believe in Tash or Aslan, seeing religion as a tool for controlling others. Increasingly takes control from Shift.

15.description: Thrown into the stable and encounters the real Tash, whom he had blasphemed. His fate becomes a warning about mocking the gods.

relationships.Tash: Destroyed by the god he mocked

6.description: A clever talking cat who becomes part of the conspiracy. More intelligent than Shift realizes, he has his own agenda for gaining power.

11.description: Proposes the idea of 'Tashlan' - that Tash and Aslan are the same being. His clever wordplay helps maintain the deception.

12.description: Enters the stable to prove there's nothing supernatural inside, but encounters something that strips away his ability to talk, reducing him to an ordinary cat.

2.description: A wise centaur and the king's trusted advisor. He reads the stars and is deeply concerned about the evil portents he sees in the heavens.

3.description: Shot by a Calormene arrow while bearing a message to the king. His dying words warn Tirian that the Aslan in the stable is not the true Aslan.

7.description: A loyal dwarf who refuses to be deceived by the false Aslan. He escapes when other dwarfs are captured and joins Tirian's small band of fighters.

16.description: Dies fighting in the last battle and enters the true Narnia, where his loyalty is rewarded with eternal joy.

7.description: Leader of a group of dwarfs who have become cynical and refuse to trust anyone. He represents the dwarfs who choose neither side.

13.description: Continues to reject all attempts at reason, determined to trust no one and believe in nothing beyond himself and his fellow skeptical dwarfs.

8.description: A young Calormene soldier who truly believes in Tash and serves him with sincere devotion, unlike his cynical superiors.

15.description: Volunteers to enter the stable, seeking to meet his god Tash face to face. His sincere faith leads to an unexpected encounter with truth.

16.description: Despite being a Calormene, his sincere search for truth and goodness leads Aslan to accept him, explaining that true service to Tash was really service to Aslan.

14.description: The true Aslan appears at last, bringing judgment and ending the old Narnia. His presence causes the stars to fall and time itself to end.
14.role: Judge and creator ending the old world

15.description: Calls all creatures to judgment, separating those who loved him from those who feared him. Shows mercy to the sincere and justice to the wicked.
15.role: Divine judge showing mercy and justice

relationships.Susan Pevensie: Sadly no longer a friend of Narnia

16.description: Leads all the faithful into the true Narnia, which is revealed to be part of his own country. The source of all good and the destination of all who truly seek him.

3.description: A great eagle who serves as a messenger. Brings news to King Tirian about the movements of enemies and the state of the kingdom.

16.description: Present in the true Narnia, where his keen sight serves the eternal kingdom.

15.description: Confronted by Aslan and commanded to depart with his prey. Represents the opposite of everything Aslan stands for.

16.description: The High King of Narnia appears in the true Narnia, having died in the railway accident. Welcomed by Aslan as one of the greatest kings of Narnia.

16.description: Appears young again in the true Narnia, having died in the railway accident. She was present at Narnia's creation and now enjoys its eternal reality.

The mother of the Pevensie children appears in the true Narnia, having died in the railway accident. She is filled with joy at the eternal reunion.

Soldiers of Calormen who are cutting down the sacred trees and enslaving talking beasts, claiming to act on Aslan's authority.

recaps.1: By Caldron Pool, the ape Shift bullies his friend Puzzle the donkey into putting on a lion's skin they found floating in the water. Shift begins to impersonate Aslan's voice, claiming the lion (Puzzle in disguise) is Aslan. Meanwhile, King Tirian of Narnia hears disturbing reports that Aslan has returned and is selling talking horses into slavery and allowing the sacred trees to be cut down.
recaps.2: King Tirian and his unicorn friend Jewel investigate the reports and find Calormene soldiers cutting down the sacred grove of talking trees under orders from 'Aslan.' Horrified by this blasphemy, they kill two Calormenes in their anger. Tirian sends Jewel to gather loyal Narnians while he seeks counsel from Roonwit the centaur, who reads dire portents in the stars.
recaps.3: Roonwit the centaur warns King Tirian that the stars foretell disaster and that the Aslan at Stable Hill is not the true Aslan. However, Roonwit is shot by a Calormene arrow before he can elaborate. Tirian realizes he and Jewel acted rashly in killing the Calormenes and decides they must surrender to Shift's 'Aslan' for judgment, despite their doubts about the lion's authenticity.
recaps.4: King Tirian and Jewel surrender to Shift and are bound to a tree as prisoners. Tirian is horrified to see 'Aslan' (Puzzle in the lion skin) and realizes this cannot be the true Aslan. In desperation, Tirian calls out to the children from another world, asking Aslan to send them help if they ever were his friends. His call for aid echoes into our world, seeking the Friends of Narnia.
recaps.5: Eustace Scrubb and Jill Pole appear in Narnia, called by Tirian's plea for help. They rescue the king from his bonds and learn about the situation with the false Aslan. Together with Tirian, they begin planning how to rescue Jewel and expose Shift's deception. They realize they are few against many enemies but are determined to fight for the true Narnia.
recaps.6: The small group of heroes witnesses one of Shift's gatherings, where the false Aslan makes an appearance before the confused Narnian creatures. They see how Shift has allied with the Calormenes and how many creatures are being deceived. Ginger the cat emerges as another schemer, while some dwarfs begin to grow suspicious of the false Aslan's behavior and commands.
recaps.7: A group of dwarfs, led by Griffle, reject both the false Aslan and King Tirian, declaring they will trust no one but themselves. However, Poggin the dwarf remains loyal and joins Tirian's band. They rescue Jewel from his captivity, and their small force grows slightly as a few loyal creatures join them. The situation becomes more desperate as the enemy forces grow stronger.
recaps.8: Rishda Tarkaan reveals his cynical atheism to Ginger, admitting he believes in neither Tash nor Aslan but sees religion as a useful tool for controlling people. Meanwhile, Tirian's band is joined by more loyal creatures including talking horses, dogs, and various woodland animals. They prepare for what seems to be a hopeless battle against overwhelming odds, but remain determined to fight for truth and freedom.
recaps.9: The heroes make a nighttime raid to rescue some of the enslaved talking horses. They succeed in freeing several animals, but the enemy forces are alerted to their presence. Rishda Tarkaan increases security around the stable and begins preparing for a final confrontation. The small band of loyal Narnians knows their time for guerrilla tactics is running out.
recaps.10: Shift becomes increasingly nervous and dependent on alcohol as he realizes his deception is unraveling. Rishda Tarkaan effectively takes control, using Shift as a puppet while pursuing his own agenda of conquest. The stable becomes the center of power, with the false Aslan supposedly dwelling inside. Tensions build as both sides prepare for the inevitable final confrontation at Stable Hill.
recaps.11: Ginger proposes the blasphemous idea that Tash and Aslan are the same being, calling this combined deity 'Tashlan.' This satisfies both the Calormenes and the deceived Narnians, allowing the deception to continue. Rishda Tarkaan embraces this lie as it serves his purposes, while Shift loses more control over the situation. The false theology spreads among the confused creatures, making the deception even more insidious.
recaps.12: Ginger enters the stable to prove there's nothing supernatural inside, but emerges as an ordinary, non-talking cat, apparently stripped of his speech by some terrible encounter. The real demon Tash has appeared inside the stable, summoned by the blasphemous worship. The situation becomes supernatural and terrifying as the false gods begin to manifest their power, bringing supernatural horror to the deception.
recaps.13: The final battle begins at Stable Hill. King Tirian leads his small band of loyal creatures against the much larger force of Calormenes and deceived Narnians. The fighting is fierce, and many brave creatures fall on both sides. Puzzle is finally freed from the lion skin and reveals the truth about the deception, but it may be too late to change the outcome of the battle.
recaps.14: As the battle rages, the true Aslan appears at last. He commands Father Time to wake up and end the world. The stars begin falling from the sky, the sun goes out, and time itself begins to end. All the creatures of Narnia are called to judgment as the old world passes away. The stable door becomes a gateway between the dying world and something far greater beyond.
recaps.15: Aslan calls all creatures to judgment, separating those who loved him from those who feared him. The cynical dwarfs refuse to believe even in the real Aslan, trapping themselves in their own darkness. Emeth the Calormene, despite his foreign faith, is welcomed by Aslan for his sincere seeking of truth. Rishda Tarkaan faces the consequences of his blasphemy as Tash claims him. The great separation begins between those who choose light and those who choose darkness.
recaps.16: Those who passed through the stable door find themselves in the true Narnia - Aslan's own country, of which the old Narnia was only a shadow. They are reunited with all the heroes of Narnia's history and discover that they died in a railway accident in our world. The Friends of Narnia (except Susan, who lost her way) are all present, along with their parents. This is the beginning of the real story, where every chapter is better than the one before, in the land where no good thing is ever lost and every joy lasts forever.
